channel.title: Rae Lynne Chornenky
channel.description: Rae Lynne Chornenky President, National Federation of Republican Women (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: I bring you greetings from the National Federation of Republican Women, an organization of more than 75,000 Republican women from across the nation.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: As in every recent election, victory in November will depend on our ability to energize and mobilize women voters.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: Recently, our National Federation conducted a survey of more than 8,500 Republican women and asked them what they want from their government.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: Number 1: They want less interference and fewer regulations.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: Number 2: They want the kind of strong, fiscal conservative leadership that only Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan can deliver.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: We hear a lot from the media about the Republican's "so-called" war against women. Well, which women?
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: Is it the 850,000 women who have lost their jobs under President Obama?
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: Or the women whose family household income has dropped by $4,300 since the President took office?
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, women lost 92% of all the jobs lost under the Obama Administration.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky

item.title: If there is a war against women, it is President Obama who has waged it. Join us in restoring sanity in our government by electing Governor Mitt Romney and Congressman Paul Ryan.
item.author: Rae Lynne Chornenky
